result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:05 pm.

2:38 PM Defendant Lacey Rae Bien in Court, Atty James Carson Whedbee Bock, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. State is ready to proceed. Sgt. Cole Clements. S/T. ADA Walker questions Sgt. Clements. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Bock. Objection, Atty Bock will rephrase. Atty Bock shows Sgt. Clements a portion of his report. Objection, sustained. ADA Walker is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over, Atty Bock argues, ADA Walker argues.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:04 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY

03:02 PM Defendant Lacey Rae Bien in Court  in custody via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in Court.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  State requests $10,000 signature bond w/AS condition.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested.  Advises of additional standard conditions.  Court questions Defendant's address, dob and phone.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy Preliminary Hearing.  DA Hatch requests case set for Status to insure that Defendant has an attorney for Preliminary Hearing.  Adjourned at 3:13 PM  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
